reviews.text: Javier is exceptional! I was alone during a happy hour and his face is just so welcoming.  He made me feel like a 5 star guest and it‚Äôs great to know they are nice people still in this crazy city.
Do you want more 5-star Google reviews? Best of all, they‚Äôre free! We can provide as many as you need to help your business reach the top of Google Maps. Contact us on Telegram: @gthisjpeg
This Mexican restaurant serves delicious tacos, burritos, and empanadas, and offers a variety of margaritas. The prices are very reasonable. happy hour is a vibe and the servers are friendly and nice
Can‚Äôt beat $5 margaritas all day long. They‚Äôre fresh and delish. Food is also yummy. Great place for happy hour or brunch.
Great food and drinks
Food was aii drinks were decent but they told us they weren‚Äôt able to celebrate the bill which is completely bs. Once he saw I was writhing a review he got a lil sassy with me.

Two stars because the Corona advertised at $5 a bottle is actually a Coronita.
Absolute stitch up
Food good though
Nice place great margaritas

Very clean esthetic bar and restaurant. The DJ was hot but the music was a bit loud. The prices are great for a group celebration just be prepared to split the check or do only 1 card.
I'll probably go again for brunch soon

Despite the good reviews the food was mediocre. Not bad. But not special in any way. The birria taco was really disappointing. I‚Äôve had the most amazing birria stew in Puerto Rico and I‚Äôve had a phenomenal one in Rochester (shout out to Tavos!). The beef was a bit dry and bland not tender enough and deeply marinated. Even the consume with it was flavorless and greasy. The empanada was more like a corn dog texture not the flakey but dense corn shell you would expect. The inside was flavorless. The pork and pineapple was similarly flavorless save for the few pineapple spears in the taco despite being (supposedly) marinated pork. The fish taco was better than the birria and the fish was cooked nicely but not overly flavorful. The salsa and chips were really good. Too bad the rest of the food wasn‚Äôt as good as the salsa! The yuzu mocktail was amazing!  The margarita was average (shout out to Lloyd in Buffalo for a stellar margarita). We liked the unpretentious decor that also didn‚Äôt go for the faux Mexican aesthetic that is everywhere else. It was calm, chill, and reminded me more of the local decor in the restaurants I went to in Puerto Rico where no one was trying to put on a show for the customers. The vibe and setting was the highlight of the meal.
Tacos and cheap $5 margaritas

The menu pleases with variety: from classic mojitos to exotic appetizers with mango and avocado. Grilled fish deserves special attention - juicy and flavorful. Coconut rice is an ideal garnish that emphasizes the taste of the main courses.

El Coco ‚Äì Hell‚Äôs Kitchen
üìç Review by @justinmateonyc

If you're looking for a vibrant, flavor-packed escape in the heart of Hell‚Äôs Kitchen, El Coco absolutely delivers‚Äîstarting with the CHIPS AND GUACAMOLE. Served with housemade chips that are perfectly crisp with just the right touch of salt, this starter sets the tone for everything to come. The guac is creamy, fresh, and full of limey zing, a classic done right.

Now let‚Äôs talk AL PASTOR‚Äîmarinated pork with sweet pineapple that hits that perfect balance of savory and juicy. But the real surprise? That pineapple chutney. It‚Äôs next level. Sweet, tangy, and a little spicy‚Äîit brought the whole dish together in the best way.

I went with the cheeseburger empanadas (yes, you read that right), and they were unreal‚Äîcrispy on the outside, ooey-gooey savory on the inside. My fianc√©e had the jalape√±o empanadas and shrimp & crab meat camarones tacos, both of which were fresh, flavorful, and had that signature El Coco twist: bold, layered flavor and beautifully presented.

The vibe here is unmatched‚ÄîEl Coco is popped out in pink, fun, and full of personality. It‚Äôs got that Instagram-ready aesthetic but without sacrificing authenticity or comfort. The energy in the room is as vibrant as the food.

Shoutout to Denise, our server, who was warm, welcoming, and super attentive‚Äîmade us feel right at home.

As a food photographer and content creator, El Coco is exactly the kind of place I love discovering. The colors, the plating, the ambiance‚Äîall photogenic and all delicious. Definitely a spot that makes my food trips across NYC worth it.

üì∏ Follow my food adventures at @justinmateonyc
#FoodieFinds #HellsKitchenEats #ElCocoNYC
Carlos is the best üî•üî•üî•
carlos was an amazing waiter!
carlos waa very nice and polite great server
Sehr lecker, etwas laut , daf√ºr super freundlich
Delicious food
This place was very welcoming and fun, Maria provided a great service and I would come again!
I love el coco! perfect vibe! maria was an amazing and beyond waiter! i highly revoked coming here.
Maria was such a great server and she made our experience so great!! i will definitely be coming again!
Maria was a great server, she was quick with food and drinks!!
Maria was our waiter and she was amazing, the atmosphere here is great! I will be coming again!

Decent food with questionable service.

Nice vibes inside and food came pretty quickly. But besides taking our initial orders, the waiter pretty much forgot about us. We were planning on order more food and dessert, but literally couldn't get their attention. We didn't get any drinks which may be the reason why.

Everyone liked their food so we might come back to give them another try if we're in the area.
Food was good, service was alright. Not too attentive. Margaritas are very small and of low quality, but you can't complain when they are $5 and prebatched i guess. Food def worth going for!

El coco is my go to spot

After work on a Saturday evening $5 margaritas!!! Ya dig
Great vibe. Nice happy hour and dinner is amazing as well
Good price for some food and drink.
Maya was a excellent hostess. I will be back  and the drinks are awesome

Super tasty drinks, more than worth it. JUST go for drinks, nothing else.
Average food. Overpriced small portions for chips and guac.

EXTREMELY loud üîä at unreasonable hours, at 5.30/6pm like it's 9pm. Cannot hear the people on your table, will definitely hear everyone screaming just to try and have a conversation.

Club energy for absolutely no reason.
a fun atmosphere and good food! i came during restaurant week and enjoyed the $30 3 course special. great drinks and great atmosphere!
Excellent service and wonderful üòä people Maria was my server, we loved her
ÏµúÏïÖ
Super loud but good drinks

Vine por el restaurant week
Pedimos:
Empanada de langosta: muy regular y simple nada impresionante

El Elote: sencillo solo queso y mantequilla

Coco Burger: seg√∫n el men√∫ trai algo de coco pero nunca lo sent√≠. La carne muy simple no ten√≠a sabor y estaba quemada

Carne asada: algo peque√±a y el sabor se resalt√≥ con el chimichurri

El tiramisu bastante regular

El ambiente bastante ruidoso mucha poblaci√≥n joven as√≠ que si no te gusta el ruido estas advertido

Tr√®s belle endroit
Bonne ambiance
Awesome service !!! Good food jaliel was amazing bartender !
Cold tacos, dry meat. Weak drinks. The Sopa de Tortilla was great.

It gave Blockheads 2.0 for me iykyk
Really fun spot with great energy. The shrimp tacos were amazing!
Literally got up charged horribly. One of the up charges was $14 for 2 sides of cheese

I went after work, It was great to catch up with my best friend over some great drinks and good food. The first drink immediately had a tipsy, and we couldn‚Äôt resist but to order more food. Definitely coming back

I had an amazing experience at El Coco! The food was delicious and full of flavor. Big shoutout to our waiter Carlos, he was super friendly, attentive, and made the whole dining experience even better. Definitely recommend this place and will be coming back.
eduardo is amazing love this place
Fun place with an affordable menu. Eduardo was great behind the bar. Would absolutely come back for happy hour or just some cheap but tasty food in Manhattan
Melissa was so sweet and the food was terrific! Definitely will be returning. Recommend for great drinks, food & service at great prices
Great spot for margaritas and tacos! Mar√≠a made our experience even better, super sweet and always attentive

We went for restaurant week and was not disappointed. 100/10 great service great food. Definitely coming around 4:30 pm is the best to avoid the excessive noise or crowd. The food was delicious and for 30 pp that was a great deal. We recommend the fish tacos . THEY WERE SO FRESH AND SO GOOD AND THE TIRAMISU WAS DELICIOUS WE HAD TO GET SECONDS.

Too loud, like club loud, steak was burnt and very small portions for the 30$ pre fix Like I got a handful of fries. Weird for NYC. Our waiter also didn't provide us the screw cap water bottle we asked for,as other people got one. We had difficulty with the pop top, and it not pouring water over the lid. He gave the same bottle and no new cup when asked for. We aren't Divas but some basic listening would be nice.

Went here for some drinks and snacks. The drink prices were really good, especially for the city. Overall, it was a good experience but not a great one.

My biggest issue was the fourteen dollar order of chips and cheese. We ran out of chips well before we ran out of dip. Our server asked if we wanted more chips, and we said sure. Then they charged us two dollars for the extra chips. That felt a bit ridiculous, especially considering the price of the appetizer and how inexpensive chips actually are.

It‚Äôs more about the principle for me. The server didn‚Äôt mention there would be an extra charge. I would have questioned it right away. It just felt like a weird move. Most Mexican restaurants give you chips for free when you sit down.

Javier is exceptional! I was alone during a happy hour and his face is just so welcoming.  He made me feel like a 5 star guest and it‚Äôs great to know they are nice people still in this crazy city.  Shrimp tacos ARE BOMB!

Amazing Mexican Food & Great Vibes! ‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê

I had an incredible dining experience at Coco! The food was absolutely amazing‚Äîfresh, flavorful, and beautifully presented. I had the seafood tacos, and they were delicious! My coworkers tried different taco options, and everyone agreed they were fantastic. The pricing was also super reasonable, with tacos ranging from just $4 to $6.

One of the highlights was their happy hour margaritas for only $6‚Äîsuch a great deal! The atmosphere was lively, stylish, and very Instagrammable, making it the perfect spot for a fun outing. AND THEY DO TO GO CUPS ü´°ü•∞

I‚Äôm already looking forward to bringing my family and friends here‚ÄîLo Coco is definitely my new go-to spot! Highly recommend! üåÆüçπ‚ú®

I checked out El Coco's Chelsea location last night and truly enjoyed everything from the service, to the food, and especially the drinks. Our server was Carlos and he was a great help when we asked for recommendations or suggestions off of the menu. We tried the El Coco Margarita which is a coconut flavored margarita (as per his recommendation) and it was delicious! Definitely will order more when I go back.
It's so cute inside & of course they play great music! They have a location on the UWS and and Hell's Kitchen. We were told that Fridays & Saturdays they have a DJ, so we will definitely be back!!

I always visit this place on Saturdays, and it never disappoints. The staff on Saturdays is absolutely amazing‚Äîsuper attentive, friendly, and full of good energy.

The vibes are unmatched: chic, tropical, and full of life. From the moment you walk in, you‚Äôre welcomed with warm service and a beautiful ambiance that makes you feel like you‚Äôre on vacation in the Caribbean.

Great music, delicious cocktails, friendly staff, and a crowd that knows how to have a good time. Whether you‚Äôre out with friends or on a date, El Coco is a must-visit. I‚Äôll definitely be back again and again!

[Edit] Couldn‚Äôt find the weekend tip policy on their website. Is this even real? I just reviewed their menu online and see that the table limit is listed as 90 minutes, right at the top of the menu. But nothing about the required 20% tip on weekend service. Knocking down to two stars, I feel disrespected as a diner for not being properly informed about this anywhere in advance and made to feel like my server might be cheating me when he selected the 20% tip button without consulting us. Not mad about paying 20% tip, mad about being treated this way.

[Edit 2] And honestly the service wasn‚Äôt stellar. Server rarely stopped by the table, and I had wanted to order more drinks. Oh, and he didn‚Äôt even offer us a receipt until we asked for one. Ok, down to one star.

El Coco needs to make it clear up front that the server will tap the 20% tip button for you on the checkout machine because there is an automatic 20% applied for service on weekends. I was very upset to see my server select ‚Äú20%‚Äù on the checkout machine for himself, and our table honestly thought he was being dishonest. After talking it out with him, he explained that this is restaurant policy on the weekends. I would have been fine with this policy if I had known up front ‚Äî people need a living wage ‚Äî but this left a bad taste in my mouth. We double checked with another server, who said the same thing.

Will confirm that the frozen margarita and pi√±a colada were pretty dang great, and I liked the low $5 price; a good bargain.

My birria taco was good; the other food was so so.

I liked the visual vibes; I didn‚Äôt like that it was so noisy. I could kind of talk but often had to ask people to repeat themselves.

Nice restaurant in a cozy setting. The food was pretty good for the most part. I had the skirt steak which was ok. The service was pretty good despite the fact that the server at the time seemed to be running the entire restaurant. He was the bartender, cashier, waiter and everything. I wouldn't doubt that he was making some of the food as well. I felt bad that he was doing everything alone but he still did a good job and was courteous as well so he gets 5 stars for that and an extra tip. I finished off the meal with the Tiramisu which was excellent.

Cute vibe and plenty of photo opportunities here. Overall, I was dissatisfied with this place though. The margaritas were extremely weak, I would not order again. The shrimp and crab empanadas were unremarkable. The Barbacoa taco and the bowls are worth ordering, as they were pretty tasty. The place was pretty busy, so maybe we went on an off day.

The food here is fresh and flavorful! Arrived with friends of four and we were sat quickly. The drinks are gooood and the vibe was fun. Carlos took care of us at our table. He was knowledgeable and a joy to be around. The experience he gave us is why people go out to eat, it‚Äôs to have fun with others. We had drinks apps and dinner plates. A great night out. The food, drinks, Carlos, the music‚Ä¶ I will definitely come back here for another fun night out.

This place was cool. I can see the appeal on going there but there were some parts that were a little interesting for me. Let's start with the positives.

Pros:
-Quesadilla was great! The cheese pull was very satisfying and the meat quality for the steak was really really good. Taste-wise, that won me over. I'd go again just for that.

-The margaritas were dangerous. They don't taste strong but they will creep up on you.

Opportunities:
-Even though the quesadilla was delicious, they serve it whole and not cut. It doesn't affect the flavor, just inconvenient to eat.

-The margaritas were so small in size. The happy hour price seems good but when the drink comes to you, the size will definitely shock you. This is a personal thing for me but they were pre-batched.

-The birria taco was lacking some flavor especially in the consum√©.

My favorite part of most restaurants/bars is the bartender/server. Great service will always improve an eating experience.

I want to check out the location in Hells Kitchen to see if I will like it better. This place has potential to get better.

Place is fun!! I saw a couple double fist drinks, lol. I was like "good sign."  I brought my kids, and it was fine, but I'd like to come back without them.  Food was good.  I really enjoyed mine.  I must commend the staff.  I mistakenly typed too much money in the  tip.  Our waiter alerted me, and I was able to fix it.  I don't remember your name, but thanks!!!! I must recommend this place for that alone.  When I'm in the area, watching a show at Joyce Theater, I'll stop by.

Came for a bite to eat with a friend and loved the ambiance and service.  Our waitress and Ali were super friendly and amazing. The food was pretty good, I had the fish taco which can be dicey but it was decent. The barbacoa taco was better, but I wish they'd given more limes. Drinks were on point and everything was reasonably priced given the portion sizes were a bit smaller.

Make a reservation.  Very popular.  Good vibe.  The tortillas that came with steak fajitas were good.  5 dollar margaritas star of the show.  The queso with chips was very runny.  More like a cheese beverage.  There were not enough tortillas for steak much less vegetables.  And the steak was too big and chewy.  Food was generally eh.  Black beans were interesting.

Exceptional Experience: A Perfect Blend of Service, Cuisine, and Atmosphere

From the moment we walked through the doors, we were greeted with warm smiles and a genuine sense of hospitality that set the tone for the entire evening. The service was truly outstanding‚Äîattentive without being intrusive, knowledgeable without being pretentious. The staff seemed genuinely passionate about the menu and made thoughtful recommendations based on our preferences. Our server was especially remarkable, checking in at the right times and ensuring our glasses were never empty. It‚Äôs rare to feel so well taken care of without the experience feeling forced or overly formal.

Now, onto the food‚Äîabsolutely phenomenal. Each dish was beautifully presented, full of flavor, and clearly made with high-quality, fresh ingredients. We started with a selection of appetizers that showcased a creative blend of textures and tastes. The main courses were equally impressive; the meat was cooked to perfection, the sauces were rich and well-balanced, and the vegetarian options were anything but boring. Every bite felt like a culinary adventure. Even the dessert managed to exceed expectations‚Äîdecadent without being overly sweet, and plated like a work of art.

The ambience of the place deserves just as much praise. The interior design struck the perfect balance between cozy and sophisticated, with soft lighting, tasteful decor, and a well-curated playlist that added to the relaxed atmosphere. Whether you‚Äôre looking for an intimate date night or a comfortable dinner with friends, the setting adapts beautifully. The layout allowed for enough privacy while still feeling part of the overall energy of the place.

In conclusion, this restaurant offers the kind of complete experience that leaves a lasting impression. From top-tier service and exquisite cuisine to a welcoming and stylish environment, every detail is thoughtfully executed. I wouldn‚Äôt hesitate to return and would highly recommend it to anyone looking for a truly memorable dining experience.

Cheap margs & really great food! Definitely will be coming back here. Had a party of 10 set for a reservation but there had been a small issue with them finding it but was resolved afterwards. This is great for any occasion or just to grab a few round of drinks . A few are around 5$+ and really good üòÅüòÅüçπüåÆ
5$ margarita, but tiny size. Also we got our food before the drinks. Definitely not authentic margarita.  Tacos were ok, but the  food so so. Will I come back, no.

My friends and I came here for drinks and small bites to celebrate completing our first year in the MSW program. We were a party of 15. Unfortunately, the service we received was extremely unprofessional. I should not have had to repeatedly go to the bar to request drink refills while the servers stood around socializing or appeared to be having their own meeting at the bar. At one point, my friend and I witnessed them flipping a coin to determine who would take the next table. That alone speaks volumes.

If gratuity had not already been included, they would have received no tip from me. And frankly, this highlights the downside of automatic gratuity‚Äîregardless of party size, excellent service should be a given. In fact, considering we were a large group on a Thursday, in the rain, making up the majority of their business that evening, I would have expected even more attentiveness.

On a positive note, I did appreciate the $6 happy hour offered all day. I chose this location because I had a great experience here in 2023, which made this visit even more disappointing. I would consider returning to another location, but I won‚Äôt be returning to this one.

The place is nice but small, noisy and crowded.  Music was good mixture of old school and more modern genres.  Took a bit to get my reserved table, but I was finally able to sit down. Be aware there is a 90-minute time limit to sit at the tables. Also, the happy hour drinks come in small glasses, which explains their low prices, but they were good. The happy hour food was more individual portions rather than shareable ones.

Service was super friendly. Food and drinks were decent, although drink sizes are pretty tiny and the margarita was pretty weak; the ambience and music were great but super loud, you can‚Äôt really hear anyone at your table talking. Also worth noting I did not see anywhere on the menu nor did the server mention at all that 20% gratuity to my party was automatically applied, so I am realizing now I accidentally tipped twice because it asked for a tip again when she ran my card at the table. This should be stated more clearly so that this can be avoided and people don‚Äôt pay double what they mean to.

Cute inside, good music, you have to flag the bartender even though it‚Äôs not a big bar. Drinks are NOT 5$ so be warned, also stick to the original marg, that skinny marg was the worst I ever had. Can‚Äôt comment on the food bc I didn‚Äôt have any.

LOUD. So loud it‚Äôs genuinely an OSHA violation, the noise level hovering around 90 decibels at all times. I could barely understand anyone at my table, let alone communicating with the servers. Ordered a frozen margarita, was brought a regular margarita, charged an extra dollar for the frozen. Food is mediocre. Wish I had known it was trying to be a club scene before I based all my dinner plans around it.
Came in for the $5 margaritas and stayed for the tacos and services. Javier was great, super friendly and professional, would definitely come back for the super chill vide and good food.

Great music, good drinks and delicious food. Everything is reasonably priced and the customer service is always amazing, our server Joe took great care of us even with so many other guests to worry about. Highly recommend for anyone looking for a great time!

- First time visit w/ my partner & we loved it!

The food was delicious delicious delicious, hospitality superb, super friendly & helpful staff, ambiance was cool however it is noisy so keep that in mind!

We ordered the ‚ÄúEsquites,‚Äù ‚Äúarroz con pollo,‚Äù y un plato de ‚ÄúEl Coco Burger.‚Äù For drinks we selected the passionfruit martini & the Paloma, superb & by the second one you‚Äôll be second guessing taking the trip to the restroom downstairs without help üòÇ.

Highly recommend this location, enjoy kiddos! üíì

The food was uniformly good. Each of the salsas was great and the tacos were tasty and made with nice tortillas. This place is just too loud. It was hard to hear the server. I didn't even bother with a conversation with my partner. A little sound dampening would go a long way towards making this a comfy place.

Ali was a great server that did a good job of explaining the deal of the day and the happy hour specials. He was very attentive and kept ensuring that we were ok.

I was disappointed in the size of the ‚Äúhappy hour‚Äù drinks but I guess you shouldn‚Äôt expect much for $5. The drinks were delicious but just misleading due to the size.

We also had the elote and spinach and cheese empanada which was delicious.

Great spot. Carlos has been our waiter 2x and he‚Äôs been great both times. Helped make sure my partners food has modifications that often get screwed up elsewhere. Music is so loud I wear earplugs, but it‚Äôs a party / scene. Don‚Äôt knock it, just enjoy it.

Not once did our server come to check on us. A man with curly hair & glasses. Had to flag him down each time, awkwardly. When we did get his attention, politely. He would say ‚Äúyeah yeah of course.‚Äù Then blatantly disregard us & carry on conversing with his friend or irrelevant tasks he could perform when it‚Äôs not busy (it wasn‚Äôt.)

There was a dead fly in our cup, disgusting. We had to remind him we needed a new drink after he just brought us a new cup? We ordered chips & salsa & fajitas, he brought out the chips a minute before our entree. That‚Äôs not usually how appetizers work. Our salsa was hot from sitting so long. Mind you he‚Äôs doing nothing, I believe I saw him breaking down boxes? While the bartender, a pleasant woman, seemed to be over exerting herself doing her job & what appeared to be his as well.

No refills were offered to us, it‚Äôs 90 degrees outside. My 6 year old son begging us for water, however getting this servers attention made us feel like we‚Äôre the ugly kids at the end of the lunch-table. The bartender ironically was the one who asked us how the service was. Not our server. We were constantly flagging this man in glasses down to ask politely for more chips, more tortillas for our fajitas, drinks; Had to vocally yell for our check, after I myself, then my wife tried to get his attention because he was too busy conversing with I‚Äôm assuming a friend of his at the bar eating Popeyes.

He knew what he was doing.

Extremely unprofessional. Borderline intentional judging by other reviews regarding this same Individual with glasses. I dare say bigoted.

The fajitas were clearly microwaved, the drinks come in 4 ounce cups. Not how I‚Äôd like to spend my Sunday. Don‚Äôt come here.

‚ÄúA TRUE GEM‚Äù Carlos was amazing, super attentive to me. But was not pushy at all, normally I do encounter lots of pushy waiters especially when they realize how I‚Äôm intentionally taking pictures of the restaurant and service so I can write my reviews. Food was great but they really forgot my sour cream and pico de gallo üò´üò´ it was supposed to be included.

Don‚Äôt be fooled by the the pink. The aesthetic is so cute but the food is so mid and unsatisfying. That went for the burrito, birria tacos, and quesadilla. Plus, the ambiance inside is actually crowded, dark, and loud. Would not recommend given that there is so much else in the city.

This burrito bowl was absolutely delicious and exactly what I was looking for. Very affordable and comes with different stuff like rice, beans, chicken, chips, cheese and a side of sour cream. Nachos were ok. I would definitely be coming back for the bowl. They have great cocktails deals for $5 and up.
Nice atmosphere, it can get very crowded. Staff is very friendly.

Cool vibes with the music but it was extremely loud and impossible to talk. What was supposed to be a catch up meal with friends turned into a shouting match and eventually we just gave up being able to communicate. The food was OK. Chicken enchiladas - the sauce was decent. The chicken was really inedible. For $22 I was pretty upset at how bad the enchiladas were. My wife's meal was OK. Our friends meals were very dry. Seems like they use toppings to cover up for bland dried out meat. Drinks were super tiny. All in it was not a great experience.
